resource.description: Admin application - for managing the database and downloading resources - this is protected by a login
Loading and accessing Activity and Activity Sets
Improved version of the distributed XML to JSON function
various system configuration files. These files could be combined in future into a single configuration file.
An inverted form of the iati-activity schema used in validation. This file needs to be kept in line with changes in the XML Schema.
The set of all corpii defined. Updated when a new corpus is created.
Defines the entities used in the application - at present contains the UI entities for the admin script and the validate script. These define all possible parameters and their default values

Defines the activity selection parameters and their paths into an activity - used in the dynamic construction of the selection part of the API. The priority number indicates the order of precedence in the computed path, which is intended to put the most selective facets before the least specific, based on the counts in the cached codelist.
Defines the codes and their paths which are to be used in creating local codelists for a corpus to provide the code lists for the API HTML interface
The resource descriptor file (which you are reading). Describes the application and its resources. Resources without @ignore will be included in the base zip file.

Default pipeline - tasks are executed in sequential order. Each transformation takes an iati-activity in and returns a, possibly augmented, iati-activity. It is intended that additional transformations using XQuery or XSLT would be able to be inserted into the pipeline. Currently all tasks are defined in iati-t.xqm. Tasks may have dependencies on prior tasks (eg currency conversion before computing the project value before allocation in proportion) so take care if reordering.
test scripts to be executed by /db/apps/sys/runTest.xq
Master code lists. The lists need to be reloaded from the iati site occasionally and when re-building
The index of all iati-codelists. Originally from the iati standard site, this has been modified to replace the path with the more useful codelist name.
ActivitySets and Activities divided into separate corpuses
List of hosts (iati data sites) and current status descriptions - common to all corpii

A log of all errors encountered in the transformation pipeline - common to all corpii but should be at corpus level. An error here usually indicates that the assumed type of an item of data has been violated - eg a percentage which is not a number or (exceptionally ) a compile error has occurred. In the event of a pipeline error, the step is ignored and the activity passed through ,so there may be consequential errors
The control list of all activity sets in the corpus
Cached codes used in the API
General System function such as test running
